markdownRemark.html:
Using Visual Studio Code, you probably noticed this behavior:

  1. You click on a file. It opens in a new tab.
  2. You click on another file. It opens the file in the same tab, replacing the previous file.

And that can feel a bit annoying. What if you want to open each file in a new tab when you click them? Why is it behaving like that? üò≠

Well, if you look closer, you can notice the tab name is italicised. In fact, this tab is a preview of the file. When you click on a file, you preview its content. Since there can only be one preview tab, the preview will change if you select another file.

Actually, this is a VS Code feature. It‚Äôs meant to prevent you from opening 10 different tabs if you are just looking for something, but you don‚Äôt intent to keep the files open. That way, you can easily see what‚Äôs inside a file, just by clicking on it.

If you want the file to open and stick in it‚Äôs own tab, you can double-click on the file name, or on the tab.

OK, but I‚Äôd prefer to open files when I click on them. How can I do that?

I hear you. Maybe you usually want to open the files you select and you find that behavior kinda annoying.

It just adds friction because you think the file is open but it‚Äôs hard to make the difference with a preview. So you forget, you click on another file and snap, your previous file is gone and you need to go get it again!

I‚Äôve got a good news for you: you can configure this behavior! üòâ

To do so, open VS Code settings. Search for ‚Äúenable preview‚Äù. You‚Äôll see a Workbench ‚Ä∫ Editor: Enable Preview option that‚Äôs certainly checked.

Uncheck that to change your editor behavior.

Notice you can also control this behavior for files you open through the Quick Open feature.

When you open a file by its name through the Quick Open feature, it‚Äôs probable you want to have it open instead of previewed. If so, uncheck the Workbench ‚Ä∫ Editor: Enable Preview From Quick Open option too.

Finally, if you prefer to update the settings.json, here are the keys you‚Äôre looking for:

{
  "workbench.editor.enablePreview": false,
  "workbench.editor.enablePreviewFromQuickOpen": false
}
